text: The preliminary round of the 2021 Africa Cup of Nations qualification tournament decided 4 teams which advanced to the group stage of the qualification tournament. The preliminary round consisted of 8 teams: Liberia, Mauritius, Gambia, South Sudan, Chad, São Tomé and Príncipe, Seychelles, and Djibouti. The 8 teams were drawn into 4 ties and played in home-and-away two- legged format. The 4 winners advanced to the group stage to join the 44 teams which entered directly. The first legs were played on 9 October, and the second legs were played on 13 October 2019. ==Matches== |} 1–1 on aggregate. Chad won 5–4 on penalties and advances to qualification Group A. \---- South Sudan won 3–1 on aggregate and advances to qualification Group B. \---- São Tomé and Príncipe won 5–2 on aggregate and advances to qualification Group C. \---- 2–2 on aggregate. Gambia won 3–2 on penalties and advances to qualification Group D. ==Goalscorers== ==Notes== ==References== Preliminary round
title: 2021 Africa Cup of Nations qualification preliminary round
